author: EasternPromises

Good evening you amazing optimizers,

I have a build I would appreciate any feedback on. This would be for the PW Forgotten Realms: Cormyr on NWN:EE so the following restrictions apply:

You must wait until level 10 to take your first Prestige Class
You many only take 1 Prestige Class
Devestating Critical is disallowed completely :) so it frees up a lot of feats for... utility?

Everything else is fairly standard other than some lower buff times for GWM and Keen weapon.

The idea is to get 16 BAB pre-epic and also manage EWF/EWS, all while keeping undispellability, hence the 6 levels of fighter. I also like to roll solo as meeting people and RPing correctly is harder than it looks.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Change your split to (4/8/8, pre-epic), you get +1 AB, just from that.

You have "extend spell" which is nice, but with "still spell" you can do wounding whispers & war-cry in combat, maybe consider switching "toughness" for that so you can have both of them. Otherwise, if you change to a one-handed weapon you free-up two feats (disarm) and you can take it from there. An (Ftr/Bard/RDD) with epic song & a shield has monstrous AC but on the other hand, I understand better than everyone the charm of the Greatsword...

Overall, your build is nice Promises, but I would like you to try and take "Lasting Inspiration" earlier in your build, it's good to be buffed 24/7.

EasternPromises wrote:
Dec 30, 2018
 amazing how much not having Dev Crit frees up.
That is so true...

Apart from that, I see one way to make the 36 level perma-song happen & that is starting with Str(17), Dex(08), Int(13) & take Lasting Inspiration as a general feat & with your bonus Bard feat take ESF: Perform.
I do not know how easy is to level up in the PW that you play in, so that suggestion might not be worth it in the end.

Another option is to take Lingering Song with one of your pre-epic feats, having a 15-round song instead of a 10-round one is a big advantage that is worth considering.
Maybe instead of the disarm feats, you could take Still spell & Lingering song.

This is going to be a powerful build when you are done with it.
Having 9-11 better AC than a full-tumble warrior, UMD, Bard song, spellcasting, huge strength & EWS & lots of skills.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Much fine analyses here already.
If I should add anything, it would be that some important things you want come late. Full RDD stats at the last RDD level. Undispellable at the last bard level. And EWS at fighter level 5 or 6. You also must have at least 4 fighter levels pre epic and follow the rule of 4 to get BAB +16.
My point is that one has to choose what one wants first.
One option is to get fighter and RDD as soon as possible, and aim for a bard8/ fighter4/RDD8 pre epic split.
But one can also choose to develop bard early with an early fighter level for the proficiencies. One can then aim for a bard16/fighter4 split or a bard12/fighter4/RDD4 split at lvl 20.

posts.author: EasternPromises
posts.content:
I can tell you leveling seems pretty slow, it being a full RP server...

Which looks better for leveling?

Fighter 4/ Bard 8 / RDD 8, getting full RDD at level 22 and EWF/EWS at 24, then pumping bard (I would take Lingering song to compensate for late Lasting Inspiration)

or

Fighter 4 / Bard 16, still getting EWF/EWS at 24, but not finishing RDD until last?

Pure STR and RDD goodies or Bard spells and utility?

Last but not least: Scimitar, longsword, or bastard sword / DW for the one handed version?

Thank you for all your insight Mick and Valerfor, these are the kinds of experienced considerations I needed.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
That is a Ftr/Bard/RDD build with many options.

Extend Spell and Still Spell, Lingering song and Lasting inspiration, Expertise & taunt combo, Improved knockdown, and Blind-fight, EWS and huge strength.
Scimitar is nice for the 12-20 critical range and having a shield also, will make you a fortress later on.

a)Take some ranks from appraise(5), tumble(3) and concentration(2) and raise perform to 40, it gives you some minor benefits.
b)Reverse curse song and extend spell order.
c) Proceed to battle.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Provide that your PW has KD-Immunity items that you can use through UMD, yes you can.
And of course, your AC will eventually be very high so their KD attempts will only succeed on the '20s.

But I would rather keep it and be on the safe side because even with KD-Immunity gear there are some enemies that like to spam DIsarm instead Or Called shot.
We usually take out Discipline on dextrous characters w/ED but that's partly because they don't usually have much of a chance in the first place.

Have fun.
